title: Frequently Asked Questions
subtitle: Find answers to common questions about our machines and services.

q1.question: Where are YILSA machines manufactured?
q1.answer: Except for electrical and electronic parts, all components are manufactured in-house.

q2.question: What kind of technical support is offered?
q2.answer: Internal technical support is available whenever required.

q3.question: What is the warranty period for the machines?
q3.answer: The warranty period for mechanical parts is 1 year, excluding buyer misuse. The warranty starts from the date of machine delivery.

q4.question: What is included in the warranty?
q4.answer: Warranty covers mechanical parts for 1 year, excluding any buyer misuse. Heat treatment and material certificates are also provided.

q5.question: What is not included in the warranty?
q5.answer: Warranty does not cover machine molds. Also, electronic devices are subject to the conditions determined by the purchasing institution.

q6.question: Who is responsible for the expenses of service personnel during the warranty period?
q6.answer: The buyer is responsible for the expenses for accommodation, travel, round-trip airfare, and meals of the service personnel.

q7.question: How long does it take for machine delivery?
q7.answer: The machine will be delivered within 2.5 months from the order confirmation date.

q8.question: Where will the machine be tested?
q8.answer: The machine will be tested in the seller's production area under the supervision of the buyer.

q9.question: When is the test considered successful?
q9.answer: The test is successful if the machine produces a final product that meets the requirements, such as the test material processed by the machine and the specified logos.

q10.question: Is there training for the machine?
q10.answer: The seller provides training for the buyer's personnel in the seller's production area. The training takes 1 day and includes the demonstration of installation and usage of the machine.

q11.question: What if I need technical drawings of male and female molds?
q11.answer: The seller will provide them on request.

q12.question: What raw materials should I use?
q12.answer: Use companies that produce steep-edge st37 soft steel rolls with dimensions of 3x11.5 mm for 5g and 3x23 mm for 10g, manufactured by the cold drawing method with wire drawing.

q13.question: Can the seller provide contact information for raw material firms?
q13.answer: If requested, the seller will provide the contact information of such firms located in Turkey to the buyer.

q14.question: What should I do before initial operation?
q14.answer: Before starting the machine for the first time, make sure that all operators have carefully read and understood the user manual.

q15.question: What social media platforms is YILSA on?
q15.answer: YILSA is on YouTube, Facebook, X, Instagram, OK.ru, and VK.

wheelWeightChopping.category: Wheel Weight Chopping and Marking Machine

q1.question: How does the Wheel Weight Chopping and Marking Machine work?
q1.answer: The machine uses Rotary Punch technology with male and female cutters on rotating drums. The sheet metal is cut and marked as the drums rotate.

q2.question: What are the advantages of using this machine?
q2.answer: Advantages include low energy consumption, rapid production, long mold life, obvious marks, burr-free cuts, and high precision. The machine also doesn't require an extra feeding unit.

q3.question: What is the production capacity of the Wheel Weight Chopping and Marking Machine?
q3.answer: It can produce 100,000 pieces per hour with rolled double sheet feeding.

q4.question: What materials can be used with this machine?
q4.answer: It uses St37 steel strip in roll with a thickness of around 3 mm. Recommended dimensions are 3x11.5 mm for 5g weights and 3x23 mm for 10g weights.

q5.question: What is the distance between the cutting blades on the machine?
q5.answer: The distance between the blades is 19 mm. This determines the cutting length.

q6.question: What is the energy cost of the machine?
q6.answer: The energy cost is 1.37 kWh in weight production of 100,000 pieces.

q7.question: What type of motor does the machine use?
q7.answer: The machine uses a 3 kW Motor and Speed Adjusted AC Drive.

q8.question: What is the control system of the machine?
q8.answer: It uses a Delta brand PLC and 7" Display.

q9.question: What is the material of the cutting molds and marking drums?
q9.answer: The cutting molds are made of 2379 Cold inner tool steel, and the marking drums are made of Vanadis 4e.

q10.question: What safety measures should I keep in mind while using the wheel weight chopping machine?
q10.answer: Keep the safety guidelines in mind to avoid injuries. Moving parts can cause serious injuries. Prior to operating the machine, make sure all safety covers are closed.

q11.question: What do I do in case of a malfunction?
q11.answer: The control panel has an "Arıza Tablosu" (Failure Log) that shows current and past errors. The "Arıza reset" (Failure Reset) button can be used after fixing the problem.

wheelWeightTaping.category: Wheel Weight Taping and Packaging Machine

q1.question: What types of wheel weights can the Wheel Weight Taping Machine produce?
q1.answer: It is capable of producing 5g+5g single drums and 5g+10g double drums, with the latter also adaptable to a 5g+5g setting. It can be used for 10g+10g and 7.5g+7.5g as well.

q2.question: What is the capacity of the Wheel Weight Taping Machine?
q2.answer: It has a capacity of 80~100 kg/h.

q3.question: What are the dimensions of the Wheel Weight Taping Machine?

q4.question: How many operators are required for the Wheel Weight Taping Machine?
q4.answer: One person can operate 2~4 sets of machines.

q5.question: What is the energy cost of the Wheel Weight Taping Machine?

q6.question: Can a packaging unit be added to the Wheel Weight Taping Machine later?
q6.answer: Yes, a packaging unit can be added without mechanical modifications.

q7.question: What is the capacity of the Wheel Weight Packaging Unit?
q7.answer: The packaging unit has a capacity of 15 boxes/hour.

q8.question: How does the Wheel Weight Packaging Unit connect to the taping machine?
q8.answer: It is attached directly to the outlet conveyor of the taping machine.

q1.question: What are the types+ of decoiler machines available?
q1.answer: There are manual and hydraulic decoilers. The purchased decoiler machine comes with a hydraulic mandrel expansion unit.

q2.question: What is the coil weight capacity of the Decoiler Machine?
q2.answer: The coil weight capacity is 2000 kg.

q3.question: What are the minimum and maximum coil inner diameters?
q3.answer: Minimum coil inner diameter: 385 mm, Maximum coil inner diameter: 510 mm.

q4.question: What is the maximum coil outer diameter?
q4.answer: The maximum coil outer diameter is 1300 mm.

q5.question: What is the coil width capacity?
q5.answer: The coil width capacity is 450 mm.

q6.question: What is the maximum working speed of the Decoiler Machine?

q1.question: What are the two main types of wheel weight production lines?
q1.answer:
The two main types are:
Decoiler + Chopping + Taping: This line uses a decoiler to feed strip sheets into a chopping and marking machine, followed by a taping machine.
Wire Flattening + Chopping + Taping: This line uses a wire flattening machine to prepare the material before chopping and taping.

q2.question: What are the components of the "Decoiler + Chopping + Taping" production line?
q2.answer:
The components include:
Decoiler: For unwinding the coil of raw material.
Wheel Weight Chopping and Marking Machine (Rotary Punch): For cutting and marking the wheel weights.
Wheel Weight Taping Machine: For applying adhesive tape to the wheel weights.

q3.question: What are the advantages of using a Rotary Punch in the production line?
q3.answer:
Rotary Punch technology offers advantages such as:
Waste Reduction: Capable of chopping the fed metal strip without generating any waste.
High Production Capacity: Can produce 100,000 pieces/hour (if there is a rolled double sheet feeding).

q4.question: What is the purpose of the Decoiler Machine in the production line?
q4.answer: The Decoiler Machine simplifies coil and sheet metal processing by unwinding the coil.

q5.question: What is the role of the Taping Machine in the production line?
q5.answer: The Taping Machine lines the manufactured wheel weight parts side by side with adhesive tapes after the coating process.

q6.question: What are the components of the "Wire Flattening + Chopping + Taping" production line?
q6.answer:
The components include:
Wire Flattening Machine: For flattening the wire into a strip suitable for wheel weights.
Chopping and Marking Machine: For cutting and marking the wheel weights.
Taping Machine: For applying adhesive tape to the wheel weights.

q7.question: What are the advantages of using a Wire Flattening Machine in the production line?
q7.answer: The Wire Flattening Machine is specifically designed for producing 5-gram wheel weights (LBA), offering a cost-effective price compared to general-purpose machines.

q8.question: What raw materials are suitable for the "Decoiler + Chopping + Taping" line?
q8.answer: Suitable raw materials include ST37 or ST42 soft steel strip or coil. It is recommended to use companies that produce steep-edge st37 soft steel rolls with dimensions of 3x11.5 mm for 5g and 3x23 mm for 10g, manufactured by the cold drawing method with wire drawing.

q9.question: What is the production capacity of YILSA Rotary Punch?
q9.answer: The monthly capacity obtained when YILSA Rotary Punch is used in the production of 5-10 g of wasteless wheel weight is 4800 boxes.

q10.question: Can YILSA provide technical support and spare parts for automatic sorting and taping machines purchased from abroad?
q10.answer: Yes, YILSA provides all kinds of technical support and spare parts.

q1.question: What are wheel weights made of?
q1.answer: Wheel weights are made of ST37 or ST42 soft steel strip or coil.

q2.question: What materials are recommended for raw materials?
q2.answer: It is recommended to use companies that produce steep-edge st37 soft steel rolls with dimensions of 3x11.5 mm for 5g and 3x23 mm for 10g, manufactured by the cold drawing method with wire drawing.

q3.question: What coatings are used for wheel weights?
q3.answer: Coatings, usually zinc, are applied to prevent corrosion. The wheel weights are also galvanized.

q4.question: What is the weight accuracy of wheel weights produced by YILSA machines?
q4.answer: Weight accuracy is maintained within 60 ± 0.5g strips.

q5.question: What sizes are available for wheel weights?

q6.question: What are the dimensions of a 5g wheel weight strip?
q6.answer: 5g wheel weights have dimensions of 19 x 11.5 x 3 mm.

q7.question: What are the dimensions of a 10g wheel weight strip?
q7.answer: 10g wheel weights have dimensions of 19 x 23 x 3 mm.

q8.question: What is the weight of a box of wheel weights?
q8.answer: A box of wheel weights weighs 6 kg.

q9.question: How many pieces of adhesive tape are in each box?
q9.answer: Each box contains 100 pieces of adhesive tape.

q10.question: What is the significance of sharp edges in wheel weights?
q10.answer: Sharp edges ensure precise application and secure fit.

q11.question: Are YILSA wheel weights self-adhesive?
q11.answer: Yes, the wheel weights are self-adhesive.

q12.question: What is the raw material thickness for the wheel weights?
q12.answer: The thickness of the raw material is 3mm.

q13.question: What is the length of the wheel weight?
q13.answer: The length of the wheel weight is 19 mm and is fixed.
